intro: Phyllostegia haplostachya var. leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stamen strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
